name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that we can compare to benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120.0 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our comparison will be benzoic acid. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxy group and a hydroxyl group. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at approximately +10°C. The hydroxyl group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +20°C. The presence of both groups raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding.
